subject: Re: Having trouble getting new junit install to work in mac osx panther
msgSnippet: Where would $HOME be on OSX?  Do you just mean my home directory?  There is no .bashrc file in there.  There was no .tcshrc file in there until I created it
messageBody:
Where would $HOME be on OSX? Do you just mean my home directory? There is no
.bashrc file in there. There was no .tcshrc file in there until I created it and if I use the
source command to run what's in that file, the next time I run my terminal program
the settings in that file are not working again and I have to source the file again.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jim Dixon <jdd@d...> wrote:
> On Mon, 19 Jan 2004, Demyanovich, Craig - Apogent wrote:
>
> > If you're using bash as your shell, you'll want to use 'export' instead of
> > 'setenv'. Furthermore, place the export command in a file named '.bachrc'
>
> That's a typo. The export command should be in
> $HOME/.bashrc
> *
>
> --
> Jim Dixon jdd@d... tel +44 117 982 0786 mobile +44 797 373 7881
> http://jxcl.sourceforge.net Java unit test coverage
> http://xlattice.sourceforge.net p2p communications infrastructure
